column5: Headed to Vaughan Lake area in about a week. Anyone have a report on what to expect for water level? Don't need any exact numbers, just if it is up or down.Oh yeah, and how has the fishing been - like it is ever bad up there.

You can check the water level of Lac Seul by going to www.lwcb.ca. Then click on basin data and then click on Lac Seul. There is a graph with the inflow, outflow and normal seasonal water level swings.
just got back on saturday from Lac Seul, water is up a couple feet

fishing has been good, I was over there guiding 4 days last week and it was all time. we slammed them. Ill be there tomorrow and the next day also. 6-9 with the best fishing at 12 feet and if you can find the humps there hitting at 15-19ft... good luck fishing
Troy, thanks for info. Once a guy knows depth and type of structure have the battle is over to finding fish.
